cluster.display: The players __________ from each other form partnerships as North‑South and East‑West.

Each deal consists of two parts – the __________, where the four players bid in a clockwise rotation describing their hands, the play, where the side that wins the bidding __________ tries to take the tricks necessary to fulfill their contract and scoring.

Each deal consists of two parts – the auction, where the four __________ers bid in a clockwise rotation describing their hands, the __________, where the side that wins the bidding auction tries to take the tricks necessary to fulfill their contract and scoring.
__________ is the language of bridge.
Its purpose is to __________ information about the strengths and weaknesses of each player’s hand to his partner.
A bid consists of a __________ and a suit (spades, hearts, diamonds, clubs or notrump, a designation indicating no trump suit).
A bid consists of a number and a __________ (spades, hearts, diamonds, clubs or notrump, a designation indicating no trump __________).
The suits are assigned value with __________ the highest, then spades, then hearts, then diamonds, and clubs the lowest.
The suits are assigned value with notrump the highest, then spades, then __________, then diamonds, and clubs the lowest.
The suits are assigned value with notrump the highest, then spades, then hearts, then __________, and clubs the lowest.
The suits are assigned value with notrump the highest, then spades, then hearts, then diamonds, and __________ the lowest.
A __________ heart bid means the pair intends to take six tricks plus __________, or seven tricks total, with hearts as trump.
A one heart bid means the pair intends to take __________ tricks plus one, or seven tricks total, with hearts as trump.
A one heart bid means the pair intends to take six tricks __________ one, or seven tricks total, with hearts as trump.
A one heart bid means the pair intends to take six tricks plus one, or __________ tricks total, with hearts as trump.
In the bidding phase, the __________ makes the first call, either a pass or a bid, and the auction proceeds clockwise until it is ended by three successive players saying Pass.
In the bidding phase, the dealer makes the __________ call, either a pass or a bid, and the auction proceeds clockwise until it is ended by three successive players saying Pass.
In the bidding phase, the dealer makes the first call, either a pass or a bid, and the auction proceeds __________ until it is ended by three successive players saying Pass.
The final bid becomes the __________.
This means that one pair has __________ to make a certain number of tricks (six plus the number indicated in the bid) in a particular suit or in notrump.
The first player to __________ the suit of the final contract – or the first to bid notrump, if that is the case – becomes the declarer.
The first player to name the __________ of the final contract – or the first to bid notrump, if that is the case – becomes the declarer.
The first player to name the suit of the final contract – or the first to bid notrump, if that is the case – becomes the __________.
The person to the __________ of the declarer makes the opening lead, and the declarer’s partner, the dummy, places his hand face up on the table.
The person to the left of the __________ makes the opening lead, and the __________’s partner, the dummy, places his hand face up on the table.
The person to the left of the declarer makes the __________ lead, and the declarer’s partner, the dummy, places his hand face up on the table.
The person to the left of the declarer makes the opening lead, and the declarer’s __________, the dummy, places his hand face up on the table.
The person to the left of the declarer makes the opening lead, and the declarer’s partner, the __________, places his hand face up on the table.
At this point, the __________ becomes an observer while his partner, the declarer, plays the cards from his own and the __________ hand.
At this point, the dummy becomes an __________ while his partner, the declarer, plays the cards from his own and the dummy hand.
At this point, the dummy becomes an observer while his partner, the __________, plays the cards from his own and the dummy hand.
At this point, the dummy becomes an observer while his partner, the declarer, __________ the cards from his own and the dummy hand.
A pair __________ its contract by winning tricks equal to or more than the number bid.
A pair fulfills its contract by winning tricks __________ to or more than the number bid.
A pair fulfills its contract by winning tricks equal to or __________ than the number bid.
A __________ consists of four cards, one from each player’s hand, played in clockwise order.
A trick consists of four cards, one from each player’s hand, played in __________ order.
When a pair does __________ make its contract – does __________ take the tricks required by the level of the bid – there is a penalty.
When a pair does not make its contract – does not take the tricks required by the level of the bid – there is a __________.
__________ bridge, the original and still most popular form of contract bridge, is played for points.
Rubber bridge, the original and still most popular form of contract bridge, is played for __________.
In __________ bridge, the same hands are played more than once, thereby eliminating much of the luck of the deal.
In duplicate bridge, the same hands are played more than once, thereby __________ much of the luck of the deal.
In duplicate bridge, the same hands are played more than once, thereby eliminating much of the __________ of the deal.
__________, limited to four deals, is a faster rubber bridge game popular in clubs and homes.
Chicago, limited to __________ deals, is a faster rubber bridge game popular in clubs and homes.
Chicago, limited to four deals, is a __________ rubber bridge game popular in clubs and homes.
to __________ a game of bridge, draw cards to select the person to deal the cards (the dealer).
to start a game of bridge, __________ cards to select the person to deal the cards (the dealer).
This person distributes the cards face down, in __________ rotation one at a time, until each player at the table has a hand consisting of 13 cards.
This person distributes the cards face down, in clockwise rotation __________, until each player at the table has a hand consisting of 13 cards.
This person distributes the cards face down, in clockwise rotation one at a time, until each player at the table has a hand consisting of __________ cards.
After the play of each __________ is completed, the opportunity to __________ moves around the table clockwise so that each person has a turn to __________ out the cards.
After the play of each deal is completed, the opportunity to deal __________ around the table clockwise so that each person has a turn to deal out the cards.
After the play of each deal is completed, the opportunity to deal moves around the table __________ so that each person has a turn to deal out the cards.
Each partnership tries to __________ (or take) as many tricks as possible.
Each partnership tries to win (or take) as many __________ as possible.
In bridge the __________ of your hand comes from two main sources: high-card points and long suits.
In bridge the strength of your hand comes from two main sources: __________ points and long suits.
In bridge the strength of your hand comes from two main sources: high-card points and __________ suits.
High-card points (HCP): Ace = __________; king = 3; queen = 2; jack = 1.
High-card points (HCP): Ace = 4; king = __________; queen = 2; jack = 1.
High-card points (HCP): Ace = 4; king = 3; queen = __________; jack = 1.
High-card points (HCP): Ace = 4; king = 3; queen = 2; jack = __________.
__________-card suit = 1; a six-card suit = 2; a seven-card suit = 3; and an eight-card suit = 4.
Five-card suit = __________; a six-card suit = 2; a seven-card suit = 3; and an eight-card suit = 4.
Five-card suit = 1; a six-card suit = __________; a seven-card suit = 3; and an eight-card suit = 4.
Five-card suit = 1; a six-card suit = 2; a seven-card suit = __________; and an eight-card suit = 4.
Five-card suit = 1; a six-card suit = 2; a seven-card suit = 3; and an eight-card suit = __________.
Once you have __________ your hand, the next step is to bid according to its strength and shape.
Once you have valued your hand, the next step is to __________ according to its strength and shape.
The __________ has the first chance to bid.
The dealer has the __________ chance to bid.
The dealer has the first chance to __________.

If the dealer has at least __________ high-card points in the hand and a preference for one suit over another (usually decided by the length of the suit), dealer makes a bid to let his partner know which suit he prefers.

If the dealer has at least 12 __________ points in the hand and a preference for one suit over another (usually decided by the length of the suit), dealer makes a bid to let his partner know which suit he prefers.

If the dealer has at least 12 high-card points in the hand and a preference for one __________ over another (usually decided by the length of the __________), dealer makes a bid to let his partner know which __________ he prefers.

If the dealer has at least 12 high-card points in the hand and a preference for one suit over another (usually decided by the length of the suit), dealer makes a __________ to let his partner know which suit he prefers.
If the dealer doesn’t have many high-cards and doesn’t want to make a bid, he says __________.
Bids must be made according to the __________ of suits: clubs, diamonds, hearts, spades and finally notrump.
Thus, if 1 __________ is the opening bid, the next hand to bid must bid at least 1 diamond, the next hand at least 1 heart and so on.
Thus, if 1 club is the opening bid, the next hand to bid must bid at least 1 __________, the next hand at least 1 heart and so on.
Thus, if 1 club is the opening bid, the next hand to bid must bid at least 1 diamond, the next hand at least 1 __________ and so on.
If declarer were to open 1 __________, the next bid would have to be 1 notrump or 2 clubs, 2 diamonds or 2 hearts.
If declarer were to open 1 spade, the next bid would have to be 1 __________ or 2 clubs, 2 diamonds or 2 hearts.
After the dealer makes a decision, each player in turn has an opportunity to either __________ or pass.
After the dealer makes a decision, each player in turn has an opportunity to either bid or __________.
At the end of the bidding, each partnership will have decided on the suit it wants to __________ as trumps and if it has enough strength (high-cards) to bid for the privilege of naming trumps.
At the end of the bidding, each partnership will have decided on the __________ it wants to name as trumps and if it has enough strength (high-cards) to bid for the privilege of naming trumps.
At the end of the bidding, each partnership will have decided on the suit it wants to name as trumps and __________ it has enough strength (high-cards) to bid for the privilege of naming trumps.
At the end of the bidding, each partnership will have decided on the suit it wants to name as trumps and if it has enough __________ (high-cards) to bid for the privilege of naming trumps.
The bidding ends when __________ players in succession say pass.
The bidding ends when three players in succession say __________.
With 0 to __________ points, pass.
With 0 to 12 points, __________.
With __________ or more points, open the bidding with one of your longest suits.
With 13 or more points, __________ the bidding with one of your longest suits.
With 13 or more points, open the bidding with one of your __________est suits.
With __________ to 17 high-card points and a balanced hand (one where all suits are represented with at least two or more cards), open 1 notrump.
With 15 to __________ high-card points and a balanced hand (one where all suits are represented with at least two or more cards), open 1 notrump.
With 15 to 17 high-card points and a __________d hand (one where all suits are represented with at least two or more cards), open 1 notrump.
With 15 to 17 high-card points and a balanced hand (one where all suits are represented with at least __________ or more cards), open 1 notrump.
With 15 to 17 high-card points and a balanced hand (one where all suits are represented with at least two or more cards), open 1 __________.
The partners on a bridge team have certain __________ to play.
The __________bidder describes his hand to his partner.
The opening bidder __________ his hand to his partner.
The opening bidder describes his __________ to his partner.
The __________ of the opening bidder becomes the captain and assumes the role of deciding on the best denomination and the best level for the final contract.
The partner of the opening bidder becomes the __________ and assumes the role of deciding on the best denomination and the best level for the final contract.
The partner of the opening bidder becomes the captain and assumes the role of __________ on the best denomination and the best level for the final contract.
The __________ of the opening bidder knows more about the combined strength of the two hands after hearing the opening bid and looking at his own hand.
The partner of the opening bidder __________ more about the combined strength of the two hands after hearing the opening bid and looking at his own hand.
The partner of the opening bidder knows more about the __________ strength of the two hands after hearing the opening bid and looking at his own hand.
The partner of the opening bidder knows more about the combined __________ of the two hands after hearing the opening bid and looking at his own hand.
Final bids can be __________, game contracts, or part-game contracts.
Final bids can be slams, __________ contracts, or part-__________ contracts.
Final bids can be slams, game contracts, or __________ contracts.
They can be __________ suit (spades or hearts) contracts or minor suit (diamonds or clubs) contracts.
They can be major suit (spades or hearts) contracts or __________ suit (diamonds or clubs) contracts.
The __________ is the player who first mentions the suit or notrump that becomes the final contract.
The declarer is the player who __________ mentions the suit or notrump that becomes the final contract.
The declarer is the player who first __________ the suit or notrump that becomes the final contract.
The __________ is the player to the left of the declarer who starts the play by making the opening lead, playing a card face-up on the table.
The opener is the player to the __________ of the declarer who starts the play by making the opening lead, playing a card face-up on the table.
The opener is the player to the left of the __________ who starts the play by making the opening lead, playing a card face-up on the table.
Against __________ contracts, it is a good idea to lead your longest suit because that could be your best source of extra tricks.
Against notrump contracts, it is a good idea to __________ your longest suit because that could be your best source of extra tricks.
Against notrump contracts, it is a good idea to lead your __________ suit because that could be your best source of extra tricks.
With a sequence, __________ or more cards in a row, lead the top card of the sequence.
With a sequence, three or __________ cards in a row, lead the top card of the sequence.
With a sequence, three or more cards in a row, __________ the top card of the sequence.
With a sequence, three or more cards in a row, lead the __________ card of the sequence.
If you have __________ sequence, lead low.
If you have no __________, lead low.
If you have no sequence, lead __________.
Against __________ contracts, you can still lead the top of a sequence, but you no longer need to lead your longest suit.
Against trump contracts, you can still lead the top of a sequence, but you __________ longer need to lead your longest suit.
Against trump contracts, you can still lead the top of a sequence, but you no longer need to lead your __________ suit.
Your __________ have a trump suit and can usually prevent you from taking tricks in your long suit.
Your opponents have a __________ suit and can usually prevent you from taking tricks in your long suit.
Your opponents have a trump suit and can usually __________ you from taking tricks in your long suit.
Your opponents have a trump suit and can usually prevent you from taking tricks in your __________ suit.
__________ it is a good idea to lead a short suit if it isn't the trump suit.
Sometimes it is a good idea to __________ a short suit if it isn't the trump suit.
Sometimes it is a good idea to lead a short suit if it __________ the trump suit.
Sometimes it is a good idea to lead a short suit if it isn't the __________ suit.
Your partnership wants to take tricks as __________ as possible.
In __________ rotation, each player has to follow suit, by playing a card of the same suit as the one led.
In clockwise rotation, each player has to __________ suit, by playing a card of the same suit as the one led.
In clockwise rotation, each player has to follow __________, by playing a card of the same __________ as the one led.
If a __________ is led, for example, each player must play a __________ if possible.
Only if a player __________ follow suit can that person discard (i.e., play a card of another suit).
Only if a player cannot __________ suit can that person discard (i.e., play a card of another suit).
Only if a player cannot follow suit can that person __________ (i.e., play a card of another suit).
The __________ card in the suit led wins the trick for the player who played it when playing a notrump bid.
The highest card in the __________ led wins the trick for the player who played it when playing a notrump bid.
The highest card in the suit led __________ the trick for the player who played it when playing a notrump bid.
The highest card in the suit led wins the trick for the player who played it when playing a __________ bid.
Having a __________ suit is something like having one suit wild.
Having a trump suit is something like having one suit __________.
When a player can __________ longer follow suit, a trump can be played, and the trump is higher and more powerful than any card in the suit led.
When a player can no longer follow suit, a __________ can be played, and the __________ is higher and more powerful than any card in the suit led.
When a player can no longer follow suit, a trump can be played, and the trump is __________ and more powerful than any card in the suit led.

You score highest for bidding and making a grand slam of __________ clubs, __________ diamonds, __________ hearts, __________ spades, or __________ notrump where you can lose no tricks to the opponents.
To bid a grand __________, the partnership should have a total of 37 or more points.
To bid a grand slam, the partnership should have a total of __________ or more points.

The next best score comes from bidding and making a small slam of __________ clubs, __________ diamonds, __________ hearts, __________ spades, or __________NT where you can lose only one trick to the opponents.
To bid a __________ slam, the partnership needs a total of 33 to 36 points.
To bid a small slam, the partnership needs a total of __________ to 36 points.
To bid a small slam, the partnership needs a total of 33 to __________ points.
There are __________ game bonuses which are more attainable than a slam contract.
There are five __________ bonuses which are more attainable than a slam contract.
There are five game __________ which are more attainable than a slam contract.
__________ notrump requires that you bid for and make 9 tricks, and the player needs about 26 points.
3 __________ requires that you bid for and make 9 tricks, and the player needs about 26 points.
3 notrump requires that you bid for and make __________ tricks, and the player needs about 26 points.
3 notrump requires that you bid for and make 9 tricks, and the player needs about __________ points.
__________ spades or hearts require that you bid and make 10 tricks and can be bid when the partnership has a total of 26 points.
4 __________ require that you bid and make 10 tricks and can be bid when the partnership has a total of 26 points.
4 spades or hearts require that you bid and make __________ tricks and can be bid when the partnership has a total of 26 points.
4 spades or hearts require that you bid and make 10 tricks and can be bid when the partnership has a total of __________ points.
__________ diamonds or clubs require that you bid and commit to making 11 tricks, and 29 points are suggested for a contract at this level.
5 __________ require that you bid and commit to making 11 tricks, and 29 points are suggested for a contract at this level.
5 diamonds or clubs require that you bid and commit to making __________ tricks, and 29 points are suggested for a contract at this level.
5 diamonds or clubs require that you bid and commit to making 11 tricks, and __________ points are suggested for a contract at this level.

Experience has shown that if you and your partner have at least __________ trump cards in your combined hands, you can usually take one more trick in a suit contract than you could in a notrump contract.

Experience has shown that if you and your partner have at least eight __________ cards in your combined hands, you can usually take one more trick in a suit contract than you could in a no__________ contract.

Experience has shown that if you and your partner have at least eight trump cards in your combined hands, you can usually take __________ trick in a suit contract than you could in a notrump contract.
In a __________ (less than a game bid), the partnership receives points for every trick made.
In a part-game (less than a game bid), the partnership receives __________ for every trick made.
In a part-game (less than a game bid), the partnership receives points for __________ trick made.
In a __________ the partnership is not eligible for the bonus it would get for bidding a game or a slam.
In a part-game the partnership is __________ eligible for the bonus it would get for bidding a game or a slam.
In a part-game the partnership is not eligible for the __________ it would get for bidding a game or a slam.
Age?
Gender?
Which is the highest level of education you have completed?
